#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Nisyros
#Text=Nisyros is a small island of the Dodecanese group , a few miles south of Kos .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Nisyros , with fewer than 1,000 permanent inhabitants , is famous for having the only ' active ' volcano in Greece together with Santorini ( Thyra ) .
#Text=The island is essentially a volcanic cone with a large collapsed caldera in the center .
#Text=It is possible to walk into the volcanic crater and view the smoking fumaroles at close hand .
#Text=There are two main villages on the island : Mandraki in the north-west ( where the ferries dock ) and Nikea , up on the edge of the volcanic rim to the south .

#Text=During the summer month the island is frequented daily by hundreds day-trip visitors from Kos that arrive on multiple boats in the morning , visit the crater , spend some time in Mandraki and leave in the afternoon .
#Text=Afterwards the island returns to its calm and relaxing atmosphere in which some traditional greek life can be enjoyed , therefore it 's worth to stay for a night .
#Text=By sea
#Text=Nisyros is a popular day-trip destination from Kos island .
#Text=During the summer month , boats leave from Kos ( Kardameina port ) at 9:30 to Mandraki and return at 15:30 .
#Text=Prices for a one-way boat-trip range from 5-8.5€ .
#Text=Nisyros is also one of the stops for ferries that run between Piraeus ( on the Greek mainland ) and Rhodes , with other nearby stops being at Kos , Tilos and Symi .
#Text=Schedules for these can be found online .
#Text=Sailings are not to a regular daily schedule and become less frequent in the winter months .
#Text=In addition , a fast catamaran service runs to Rhodes on some days ( via Tilos ) .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The villages on the island are small enough to stroll around on foot .
#Text=To travel between them , two there is an occasional bus service , the schedule can be found on http://www.nisyros.gr.
#Text=There are also about two taxis on the island .
#Text=Given that there ’s essentially only one road , hitchhiking is also an easy option .
#Text=There is a car and motorcycle rental based on the main port .
#Text=Manos tel 2242031029 .
#Text=Eagle 's Nest Car & Bike Rental ( Pali Harbour ) , ☏ +306932732906 .
#Text=Mike and his American wife Marilyn give very friendly service and very good tour advice .
#Text=The office is next to the church in Pali Harbour .
#Text=Mike is also a mechanic and the go to man for assistance .
#Text=Alternatively , it is a half day 's hike between the two villages , via the volcanic crater .
#Text=See
#Text=The walk-in volcanic crater . .
#Text=A path leads down to the yellow sulphur stained floor where you can walk up to and view the steaming vents .
#Text=Try to avoid being here when the day-trip visitors come ( ~11:00 ) .
#Text=There ’s a small café with shaded seats after the entrance .
#Text=3€ ( free if you hiked there ) .
#Text=Nikia .
#Text=A mountain-village at the ridge of the crater .
#Text=The village is pretty , painted in blue and white .
#Text=There ’s one square with 2 restaurants .
#Text=There ’s a view-point to see down into the crater valley .
#Text=Do
#Text=Hiking between Mandraki and Nikia via the volcanic crater is a great day-trip .
#Text=Beware of the elevation and the sun and pack enough water .
#Text=The island ’s peak can also be climbed , apparently one could sleep there with a sleeping bag ( unverified ) .
#Text=There are multiple hiking paths between and Mandraki and the volcanic crater .
#Text=The one east of the mountain is hard to find for the last part until it hits the paved street leading to the crater .
#Text=OpenStreepMap maps have good coverage of the trails .
#Text=Most hotels on the island also have free maps available for anyone interested in walks around the island .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Mandraki has many restaurants .
#Text=If you go with a group , try to avoid the places where the tour guide sends you to eat .
#Text=Some tour guides get a commission from the restaurants , which means it will be expensive .
#Text=Look around and try to avoid the main tourist pathways .
#Text=Nikia and Emborios have just 1-2 restaurants , the tavern in Emborios has a great view of the crater valley .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Mandraki has a few bars and lots of restaurants inviting for a drink .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There ’s very few hotels on the island .
#Text=On some days all may be booked out .
#Text=Book in advance and make sure to check with the hotel in case you ’re arriving late .
#Text=Most hotels in Mandraki are in the port area .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Ta Liotrida , Mandraki , ☏ +302242031580 , ✉ info@nisyros-taliotridia.gr .
#Text=Tria Aderfia ( Three Brothers ) , Mandraki , ☏ +302242031344 .
#Text=Simple rooms , very friendly owner .
#Text=Right next to the port .
#Text=double-room from 32€ .
#Text=Mid-range
#Text=Hotel Porfyris , Mandraki ( 400m from the sea ) .
#Text=2-star hotel with 38 rooms .
#Text=Haritos , Mandraki , ☏ +302242031322 .
#Text=11 rooms
#Text=2-star hotel with 47 rooms .
#Text=3-star hotel with 20 rooms .
